text:
Amber color and average head.
Hoppy and caramel aroma.
Taste is sweet and bitter finish...
Nice one from Switzerland

0.33l bottle from coop near zurich hb. pours a clear pale amber with a huge frothy head. aroma of floral and tropical fruity hops, very nice. flavour of woody hops, oak, blood oranges, lemongrass. balanced, more dry finish with a subtle but lingering bitterness.

bottle @ home
light hazy amber, cream orange head
cream, red orange, mou, light yeast, hops
carbonation, bitter orange, red orange juice

Grain and cereal malts, light caramel, light biscuit, light floral hops. Hazy, dark gold, medium frothy, off-white head. Medium bitter. More grain malts, floral hops, grass, bitterness intensifies, medium carbonation, medium bodied. Decent California Common, well-balanced, good bitterness. Bottle from Drinks of the World, Zurich.

Butelka 330ml (BB 12.2017). Piwo delikatnie mgliste o bursztynowo-pomarańczowej barwie z białą, lekko przybrudzoną, drobną i obfitą pianą. Aromat słodkawy, delikatnie słodowy, nieco landrynkowy choć bezpośrednio po otworzeniu butelki przez kilka chwil były obecne delikatne nuty owocowe. W smaku delikatnie słodowe, słodkawe od słodu, leciutko owocowe z wyraźną, na średnim poziomie, goryczką o charakterze żywiczno-ziołowo--cytrusowym, intensywną ale krótką w czasie przy czym zalega już dość dłużej, leciutko ściągając ale wszystko w bardzo przyjemny sposób. Piwo jest pełne w odczuciu ze średnim ciałem, przyjemnym ale nie za wysokim nasyceniem,co sprawia, że pije się je dość szybko dając niezłe orzeźwienie.
bottle bb 1/18 leggero ambrato velata buona schiuma persistente naso agrumato ed erbaceo con note terrose una leggera pesca abbastanza amara buona intensita

I was by boat with my daughter Lausanne-Le Bouveret and back. I was really happy that they were proposing this beer and to have another choice than a cardinal or carsberg. It is a decent pale ale, powerful and well balanced. The taste is with a nice hop, citrus, malty and nice bitterness at the final and refreshing. The body is copper and clear, regular carbonation, white and brown foam, good.

Hoppy aromas of tart apricots. Pours a cloudy gold with an very big off-white head with large bubbles some lacing. Subtle sour notes of leather and balanced hops. Medium to high carbonation with a crisp abrupt finish. Very nicely made beer.

Bottle. Batch #21. A nice refreshing beer, whos dryness and a bit too thin body not quite matches the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Batch 15. Clear orange, lots of off-white head.
Aroma: Fruits, light hops. Floral.
Taste: Light fruits and hops. Light lingering bitterness. Tastes American. Nice.
Bought: Drinks of the World (Basel), 330 ml, CHF 5.60
Info: 2/4-2016, BB: 30/6-2016

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing! Pours hazy dark orange golden colour with a mid-sized good lasting beige head. Aroma of mild dry fruits, peaches, grapefruit. Taste of mild dry hops, fresh and round, grapefruits, peaches, some grains, good stuff!
Many thanks to CH-303 for this bottle! The beer starts round and typical. Dry with not much depth, easy to drink with a dry grainy body. Fresh in the aftertaste, grain, typical yeast. Nice.

Bouteille achetée Au Grain dOrge - De couleur orangée trouble avec une belle mousse blanche qui tient - Au nez des arômes fruités, agrumeux, houblon frais ( houblonage à cru), un peu herbacée, un côté malté caramel assez léger - En bouche toujours très fruité, agrumes, fruits tropicaux, beaucoup plus herbacée, le corp malté se fait plus présent, et le côté caramel ressort plus aussi, on retrouve le côté croustillant des levures lager - Corp léger, amertume moyenne, carbonation correcte, un peu aqueuse, final amère et herbacée - bière rafraîchissante et bien réalisée un peu aqueuse mais ça me dérange pas
Bottle from Drinks of the World Zurich. Light amber body with medium head. Nose of sweet, honey, and floral. Taste is nice and hoppy with good pine and honey notes. Really smooth. Enjoyable.
A delicate litchi in the nose, strong flavours in the mouth, well rounded and fresh to drink. A classic beer and a perfect drink.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2016 Orange color with foam layer. Fruity and citrus hoppy smell. The taste is fruity/peach hoppy and has a strong present carbonation. Spicy peppery hints in the finish with a little bitter and tart aftertaste.
At CBF Rapperswil. Deep orange-amber color with white head. Aroma is light fruit and freshness, some butter, but not too much. Fresh fruity taste, not bad. Not as weird as other California Commons.
Tap at CBF. Floral aroma, quite nice. Taste is killed by carbonization though. Maybe it needs to be warmer?

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. Pours a clear dark orange color forming a small non persistent off white head that leaves only few lingering lacings in the glass. Strong hoppy nose. Strong notes of watermelon and mango. American style hops. Delicious Simcoe piny notes too. Taste follows the nose. Slightly sweet upfront. Strong noted of crystal and caramel malts. Very fruity with notes of mango, grapefruit and watermelon. Slightly bitter and grassy hoppy taste. Light body and persistent grassy and grainy aftertaste. Great balance. Good carbonation. Excellent drinkability. Great California Common produced in Switzerland.

Bottle from Au Grain dOrge, Crissier; brewed 03Nov2014, bb 03May2015Hazy copper-amber color with medium sized compact head. The aroma is fresh, delicate, fruity and a bit floral; peach and apricot. Dry mouthfeel; the malt profile is rather simple, with a feeling of paper; relatively strong bitterness, a bit resiny, but more hop quality is expected.Nice.
Good common, light amber, clear. Small white head, nice lacing. Woody, earthy, balanced.
Couleur jaune dorée, mousse blanche; arômes fruités; goût moyennement houblonné et un peu malté; finale avec une amertume intéressante; belle découverte

from Apothibières - murky dark amber-blond beer with a little yet long lasting foam; fair citrusy aroma in the front and light notes of caramel and lemongrass behind; a good malt backbone, decently tasty, lively palate and with a fair yet subtle carbonation; gently bitter and pretty dry; long fruity and flowery hoppy finish - charming and well-crafted

Cool enfin une bière suisse qui se rapproche de cette nouvelle génération de ales puissantes en arômes. Un très joli nez offert par le houblonnage à cru. Un goût qui laisse entrevoir discrètement les agrumes et le pin. Et un palais très léger.
UPDATED: APR 23, 2014 A very refreshing product, as much concerning the taste that the fact theyre a very young brewery, but full of promises

UPDATED: APR 24, 2014 Entre ale et lager, cette bière au style hybride de couleur ambrée à la mousse crème, qui retombe facilement, offre au nez un cocktail entre houblons simcoe et leurs notes végétales (dominants) et malt caramels (moins prononcés). De corps extrêmement léger, elle reste en bouche assez discrète avec toutefois une amertume moyenne provenant de lhoublonnage à cru. Belle découverte.
